ProfessionalSummary:
I'm a product designer and UX Writer
that focuses on creating usable and
beautiful user experiences and interfaces
that solve user's problems and meets
business goals. I am passionate about
inclusive design for all categories of
users and I take delight in using design
to	solve	problems	and	create
exceptional experiences.

ExperienceSummary.Description: The candidate is experienced in:  Information Technology (Programming; User Interface); and User Experience. The candidate appears to be an entry-level candidate, with 9 months of experience.

Positions.Description:
Worked with a team to deliver visual direction for a website and dashboard design.

Collaborated with the team to determine user flows and interactions.
Designed several interactions to enable the best user experience.
•   Participated in brainstorming sessions to deliver designs that align

specifically with the business goals.

• Worked in collaboration with other interns on the visual and interaction designs of a website.
• Collaborated with a front-end developer to deliver website and mobile designs within a very short deadline.
• Delivered several web and mobile designs of projects.
• Worked under a strict weekly timeline to meet deliverables.

JobTitle.Normalized: Front end Developer AND UI/UX Intern

Positions.Description:
• Created interactive prototypes of a mobile app design.
• Participated in usabiliy testing of mobile apps.
• Wrote HTML5 & CSS3 for front-end development tasks.

• Collaborated with senior developers to develop project for websites.
•   Maintained websites and applications, including content updates.
•   Created custom HTML emails for clients/in-house newsletters.

Findings.Message: We detected that this document contained at least some data that was laid out as columns or tables. We rearranged that data to make it more usable. NEVER use columns or tables in a resume.
You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.
A first and last name was not found in the contact information. A resume should always include the candidate's first and last name.
Every section should have text associated with it. This usually indicates an error with the section headers or format used in the resume.
A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.
Every position in a resume should have an employer name.
Every degree in a resume should have a name or type associated with it, such as 'B.S.' or 'M.S.'.
High school (or lower) education should not be included on resumes that contain higher-level education.

The following section was identified as a skills section type: 'SKILLS'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education. THIS IS INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT FOR AI MATCHING ALGORITHMS
Multiple email addresses were found in the contact information. Only one email address should be included in a resume.
Multiple phone numbers were found in the contact information. Only one phone number ( a mobile number) should be included in a resume.
